document.title: K-10 Outline School Curriculum and Standards Authority

F7BD52311BD84400A15A282A507E2AFA.description: Write consonant-vowel-consonant (CVC) words by representing some sounds with the appropriate letters, and blend sounds associated with letters when reading CVC words

F838F5492C1143FE978355EDF5C84A27.description: Segment sentences into individual words and orally blend and segment onset and rime in single syllable spoken words, and isolate, blend and manipulate phonemes in single syllable words

4F35FFC4B7B74253A98716A4B9E8FFCD.description: Understand that words are units of meaning and can be made of more than one meaningful part

721DEC8CA0E543B68537123934AA1AEC.description: Know how to read and write some high-frequency words and other familiar words

4243A83A49BB4B2185D24C0C8F5F9FE7.description: Understand how to use knowledge of letters and sounds including onset and rime to spell words

410F569DFCD64AFC88A7AFF0B0D075CE.description: Recognise and generate rhyming words, alliteration patterns, syllables and sounds (phonemes) in spoken words

B7212C440DBF4F679C6FA839B77844B2.description: Understand the use of vocabulary in familiar contexts related to everyday experiences, personal interests and topics taught at school

D23F8EF5DCC14CDE85C8B7E307C4162C.description: Explore the different contribution of words and images to meaning in stories and informative texts

7F42D0A7EE0A488D8271580EB6BEEEF3.description: Recognise that texts are made up of words and groups of words that make meaning

4E7B10B52D554C38A51D1E3A800DC5B9.description: Recognise that sentences are key units for expressing ideas

D4DEF3BFB079474DB8B0D7662B9A23E2.description: Understand concepts about print and screen, including how books, film and simple digital texts work, and know some features of print, for example directionality

9C915FA356864904964B85AAFB67E871.description: Understand that punctuation is a feature of written text different from letters; recognise how capital letters are used for names, and that capital letters and full stops signal the beginning and end of sentences

63947606A5DC417DA2248BC55B6B8EC6.description: Understand that some language in written texts is unlike everyday spoken language

88D73F922B214276A9C185DED509A52A.description: Understand that texts can take many forms, can be very short (for example an exit sign) or quite long (for example an information book or a film) and that stories and informative texts have different purposes

EED35B6A0022412AB66F48F605531163.description: Understand that language can be used to explore ways of expressing needs, likes and dislikes

6B38E49537BB4533B021B2C9048EB880.description: Explore how language is used differently at home and school depending on the relationships between people

1F7F3913B8FC45E38E3EEA6C17101988.description: Understand that English is one of many languages spoken in Australia and that different languages may be spoken by family, classmates and community
